com.almasb.fxgl.app

Class GameApplication

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.application.Application
      • com.almasb.fxgl.app.FXGLApplication
        • com.almasb.fxgl.app.GameApplication

  • public abstract class GameApplication
extends FXGLApplication
    To use FXGL extend this class and implement necessary methods. The initialization process can be seen below (irrelevant phases are omitted):

    1. Instance fields of YOUR subclass of GameApplication
    2. initSettings()
    3. Services configuration (after this you can safely call getService())
    4. initAchievements()
    5. initInput()
    6. initIntroVideo() (if enabled)
    7. initMenuFactory() (if enabled)
    8. initAssets()
    9. initGame()
    10. initPhysics()
    11. initUI()
    12. Start of main game loop execution

    Unless explicitly stated, methods are not thread-safe and must be executed on JavaFX Application Thread.

    Author:
    Almas Baimagambetov (AlmasB) (almaslvl@gmail.com)

      • initAchievements

        protected void initAchievements()
        Override to register your achievements. 
         Example:

 AchievementManager am = getAchievementManager();
 am.registerAchievement(new Achievement("Score Master", "Score 20000 points"));

      • initInput

        protected abstract void initInput()
        Initiliaze input, i.e. bind key presses / key typed, bind mouse.

        This method is called prior to any game init. 

         Example:

 Input input = getInput();
 input.addAction(new UserAction("Move Left") {
      protected void onAction() {
          player.translate(-5, 0);
      }
 }, KeyCode.A);

      • preInit

        protected void preInit()
        This is called after core services are initialized but before any game init. Called only once per application lifetime.

      • initIntroFactory

        protected IntroFactory initIntroFactory()
        Override to use your custom intro video.
        Returns:
        intro animation

      • initMenuFactory

        Override to user your custom menus.
        Returns:
        menu factory for creating main and game menus

        Initialize game assets, such as Texture, Sound, Music, etc.

      • saveState

        public Serializable saveState()
        Called when MenuEvent.SAVE occurs.

        Default implementation returns null.

        Returns:
        data with required info about current state

      • loadFromDefaultProfile

      • getWidth

        public final double getWidth()
        Returns target width of the application. This is the width that was set using GameSettings. Note that the resulting width of the scene might be different due to end user screen, in which case transformations will be automatically scaled down to ensure identical image on all screens.
        Returns:
        target width

      • getHeight

        public final double getHeight()
        Returns target height of the application. This is the height that was set using GameSettings. Note that the resulting height of the scene might be different due to end user screen, in which case transformations will be automatically scaled down to ensure identical image on all screens.
        Returns:
        target height

      • getScreenBounds

        public final javafx.geometry.Rectangle2D getScreenBounds()
        Returns the visual area within the application window, excluding window borders. Note that it will return the rectangle with set target width and height, not actual screen width and height. Meaning on smaller screens the area will correctly return the GameSettings' width and height.

        Equivalent to new Rectangle2D(0, 0, getWidth(), getHeight()).

        Returns:
        screen bounds

      • getTick

        public final long getTick()
        Returns:
        current tick

      • getNow

        public final long getNow()
        Returns:
        current time since start of game in nanoseconds
